_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The practice that's conducive to extingu: Seeing that the eye, sights, eye consciousness, and eye contact are suffering
Seeing that the painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by eye contact is also suffering
Seeing that the ear, sounds, ear consciousness, and ear contact are suffering
Seeing that the painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by ear contact is also suffering
Seeing that the nose, smells, nose consciousness, and nose contact are suffering
Seeing that the painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by nose contact is also suffering
Seeing that the tongue, tastes, tongue consciousness, and tongue contact are suffering
Seeing that the painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by tongue contact is also suffering
Seeing that the body, touches, body consciousness, and body contact are suffering
Seeing that the painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by body contact is also suffering
Seeing that the mind, thoughts, mind-consciousness, and mind contact are suffering
Seeing that the painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by mind contact is also suffering.
